body:
Example I have one page for several resources, and after updates I should be redirected to the page with minimal changes to code.

```ruby
# config/routes.rb
get 'homes', to: 'homes#index', as: [:home, :customers, :sellers, :visitors]
```

```ruby
# app/controllers/{users|sellers|visitors}_controller.rb

render_with(@user, location: customers_path)
render_with(@seller, location: sellers_path)
render_with(@visitor, location: visitors_path)
```

It could be done via this:
```ruby
%w(home customers sellers visitors).each {|name| get 'homes', to: 'homes#index', as: name}
```

I could not remember the real example, why I need this, it was long time ago.

So the main goal is add ability to create aliases to url helpers.
